summary: This is an FBI internal request form from the Miami Division to the Records Management Division and Special Technologies and Applications Office, requesting scanning and automation assistance for telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The document reveals Rodriguez, former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein, attempted to sell an address book believed to contain names of additional underage victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of an FBI obstruction of justice case opened in October 2009. He came into possession of an address book believed to contain names and telephone numbers of additional underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein and attempted to sell it.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of a child prostitution case. Alfredo Rodriguez was his former house manager and butler.

persons.name: William T. Murphy
persons.context: Addressed in the routing information of the internal FBI request form.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez came into possession of an address book believed to contain information on Epstein's associates and potential underage victims.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction case against Rodriguez
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: FBI requests scanning of telephone records
events.description: FBI Miami Division submits a formal request to the Document Conversion Laboratory to scan and process telephone records related to the Alfredo Rodriguez obstruction case.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager, was the subject of an FBI obstruction of justice case opened in October 2009.
Rodriguez came into possession of an address book containing names and telephone numbers believed to be additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez attempted to sell the address book to an Undercover Employee (UCE) instead of turning it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas.
The FBI was processing telephone records (target number 714-841-1171) obtained from the address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims.
This document is an internal FBI technical request for scanning and data formatting assistance, indicating the procedural steps taken to digitize evidence for the investigation.
